alert.note: Alert for Albany (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 4:33PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall and runoff from upstream continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central Wyoming and southeast Wyoming, including the following counties, in south central Wyoming, Carbon. In southeast Wyoming, Albany. * WHEN...Until 645 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 433 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Six Mile Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
